item.title: iran, iraq sign extradition accord
item.description: iran and iraq have signed an extradition agreement, the latest step in warming relations between the former warring neighbors, but baghdad denied it would be used to repatriate exiled militants to iran.

item.title: soyuz docks 50 years after gagarin's voyage
item.description: a soyuz craft adorned with a portrait of the first man in space docked with the international space station thursday, days before the 50th anniversary of yuri gagarin's pioneering flight.

item.description: a soyuz craft adorned with a portrait of the first man in space docked with the international space station thursday, days before the 50th anniversary of yuri gagarin's pioneering flight.

item.title: qa: changing the functions of a mac's f-keys
item.description: how to reconfigure the function keys to make them work like they used to on macs.

item.title: mets closer is smiling through the pain
item.description: francisco rodriguez the once moody and, in at least two cases, violent relief pitcher has been replaced by a calmer, more reflective player in 2011, teammates and coaches attest.

item.title: israel holds 2 palestinians over settlement killings
item.description: israeli police have arrested two palestinian teenagers on suspicion of stabbing to death a jewish couple and three of their children while they slept in a west bank settlement, a police spokesman said on sunday.

item.title: u.s. sues deutsche bank in mortgage fraud case
item.description: the government sued deutsche bank ag for more than $1 billion, accusing the german bank of fraud for repeatedly lying to obtain federal guarantees on mortgages it issued.

item.title: mary tyler moore to undergo brain surgery
item.description: tv legend mary tyler moore will have surgery to remove a benign brain tumor.

item.title: need overwhelms japan after quake and tsunami
item.description: hundreds of bodies are washing up along some shores, making clearer japan's extraordinary death toll and adding to the burdens of relief workers as they ferry aid and search for survivors.

item.title: thailand sets date for crucial election
item.description: thailand is to hold a general election on july 3 in what is expected to be a close contest that could reignite a violent political conflict that has dogged the country for five years.

item.title: wal-mart to reopen 12 quake-hit stores in japan
item.description: wal-mart stores inc will re-open 12 of its seiyu stores in japan which were affected by the earthquake, and is hoping to open the remaining 12 impacted stores as soon as possible, a spokesman for the u.s.-based retailer said.

item.title: research: unemployment plays role in early deaths
item.description: unemployment can be deadly, especially for men, researchers have found.

item.title: blue jays send struggling pitcher brett cecil to minors

item.description: the number of job openings rose at their fastest pace in almost seven years in february, according to a new report from the labor department.

item.title: aspirin, other meds linked to stomach bleeding risks
